title: 6.8 patch. Mac bug still here. What's the excuse Riot?
body: We have been constantly asking for updates. Still no fix.

replies.body: Client is crashing post-champ select no matter what I try to do. Hope you find a fix soon, felt bad that I just gave my teammates a 4v5 to deal with.

I didn't realize this was a known issue until just now. I actually had this happen to me on 2 ranked games tonight. I quit the full client, even restarted my computer once, and I still get the black screen of death. I really hope it is addressed soon and that they don't dock people LP to heavily if this happened to them. I lost at least 40 from this.

I had this problem happen to my laptop, which was really problematic. 
Ultimately, as a last resort against having to fully factory reset my computer, I decided to look for every file related to the game and delete it. 
Interestingly enough, the app isn't even the problem. LOLClient was what was causing me my problems.
After I reinstalled, everything worked, but my computer started lagging REALLY hard afterwards, so if you're okay with playing a bleh-FPS game vs no game at all, just root through your stuff and sift out the stuff in your Library.
I don't think this is of any use. But I read in some other threads that if you have LolReplay program installed in your computer, uninstalling it is fixing the League Client.
Yeah. Can my teammates and I get out LP back? This is ridiculous.
If I'd have know there was a bug with mac, I wouldn't have queued up for a ranked game. :/

Hey Summoners,

For y'all who are still experiencing these problems after the 6.8 patch, could you please provide:

- Your system specs, in particular:
-- OSX Version
-- GPU Model
-- CPU Model and Speed
-- RAM

- Are you still experiencing both the audio-corruption and in-game performance issues?

Still experiencing both the audio corruption and in-game issues.

Mid 2010 Macbook Pro
10.11.4 El Capitan
NVIDIA GeForce 320M 256 MB
4 GB 1067 MHz DDR3
2,4 GHz Intel Core 2 Duo

-OSX El capitan 10.11.4
-Nvidia Gforce 320M 256MB
-2.4GHz Intel Core 2 Duo
-4 GB Ram

Yes. Still have issues.

> [{quoted}](name=RiotDecrepit,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=8gxEE5vQ,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2016-04-21T23:00:24.024+0000)
>
> Hey Summoners,
> 
> For y'all who are still experiencing these problems after the 6.8 patch, could you please provide:
>

> -- OSX Version

> -- CPU Model and Speed
> -- RAM
> 
> - Are you still experiencing both the audio-corruption and in-game performance issues?

Hey Decrepit,

Another unique issue but I am unsure whether it is related to Macs in particular (others would have to weigh in too). So after the bug was fixed the work done on PBE and now live seems to have done a pretty good job at getting rid of the major fps issues. I was once on Very low with about 40 frames but now I can play high-very high again with 60-70 frames. The weird non-ping related/non-frame related stuttering is at a minimal and frames drops are also not as bad but could still use a bit of improvement. The one big issue, however, is that frames tend to slowly drop during the course of the game, if the game lasts longer than 35-40 minutes they tend to be down in the ~20 range. This happens no matter what setting I have the game. I was thinking it could be a memory leak? I don't know but thanks for looking into the issues with mac users.

 Mid-2013 Macbook Air
OSX: 10.11.4 El Capitan
GPU: Intel HD 5000 1536 MB
CPU: 1.3GHz Intel core i5
RAM: 4GB 1600 MHz

I have two systems with this problem so here at the specs as follows:

Mid 2009 Macbook Pro
OSX Version 10.11.4 El Capitan
2.26 GHz Intel Core 2 Duo
8GB Ram 
NVIDIA GeForce 9400M 256 MB


Late 2012 Mac Mini
OSX Yosemite
I5 2.5Ghz Core 2 Duo
8GB Ram
HD Graphics 4000 1500MB


I played 3 games since the update on the Macbook Pro and 3 on the Mac mini. I did not experience any audio-corruption from start up, however the FPS drop were so terribly bad in comparison to patch 6.7 that I had no choice to disable all audio before I even had the opportunity to wait 15 or so minutes like I did previously for the audio to start layering & distorting.

I typically play anywhere from 45-75 FPS no matter what the situation, what abilities, champions, etc are on screen. Patch 6.7, I would crash down to literally 1 FPS during teamfights when audio was enabled. With all audio disabled, I would get anywhere between 20-40, still playable.

Patch 6.8, I am jumping anywhere from 5-15 FPS with audio on, or off, no matter what the situation. This patch has indeed made things worse.

Hey! 

On PBE it looks like things were working with no issues, we had folks testing it there. (Testing on PBE is better than testing in-house 'cause it's a cooked build, and more similar to what we would push to live) Based on that, we were fairly confident that this issue would be resolved.

However, that doesn't appear to be the case. (Obviously.)

From what I understand, we will be making a post in Help & Support soon, looking for more information from you guys to help us figure out what the heck is going on. In addition, they should be giving an update with any additional information we have on our end.

(Again, c/p for visibility)
No fix yet, still having major FPS drops from 75 FPS down to 5-10 consistently. Whats the verdict here.

We are aware that this occurring for some players, although a good chunk of this has been resolved for for players. 

That said, we have manually  run through configs [similar to what we've been given on the boards](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/RGU33M7z-mac-fpsaudio-issues) that have this issue, and we are unable to get a repro. 

Could you please provide the following info and post it on that thread - 

System Specs, specifically:
-- OSX Version
-- GPU Model
-- CPU Model and Clock Speed
-- RAM

> -- CPU Model and Clock Speed
> -- RAM

Sytem Specs for Macbook Pro (Retina, 15-inch, Late 2013):
- OSX Version: OS X El Capitan Version 10.11.4
- GPU: Intel Iris Pro 5200 Graphics with DDR3L SDRAM
- CPU: Integrated 2.3 GHz quad-core Intel Core i7-4850HQ version with optional discrete Nvidia GeForce GT 750M with 2 GB dedicated GDDR5 video memory
- RAM: 16 GB 1600 MHz DDR3

Yes I am still experiencing issues with both performance and in-game audio after patch 6.8.

Usually, the performance drops, then the audio glitches out (looping endlessly) before dropping completely. I encounter this bug consistently in the mid-late game when there are team fights going on anywhere on the rift consisting of 4 players or more. When the error occurs, the minion movement and animation stops, and all champion ability animations stop. However, I can still move my champion around the rift, and see my health go up and down, I can also cast abilities, but there are no visual indications of the casting. My champion moves, and the mana goes away, but theres no visual indication that the ability was cast. Likewise, I can place wards, but the ward never leaves my inventory, despite illuminating the surrounding fog of war. Once the team fight stops, my game jumps over the action that occurred during the latency/lag/bug and my game begins to respond again, with animations and sounds restored.

This error does not occur during the laning phase when last hitting minions with only one or two other champions on screen besides myself. Based on this performance, the bug seems to be related to when many champion abilities are cast at once. This bug began in patch 6.6 for me, and I had never encountered this bug before between patches 5.20 and 6.6.

Hope this helps, thank you for the hard work you guys are doing. I appreciate it. Cheers!

Hey The 5tig -

Thanks for all of the additional context, this is great. :) Thanks for being so patient with us! I've gone ahead and passed this along to the team working on this. They'll be able to take a look and hopefully get a better idea as to what's happening here.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=8gxEE5vQ,comment-id=00020002000000000000,timestamp=2016-05-02T16:27:56.799+0000)

> 
> Thanks for all of the additional context, this is great. :) Thanks for being so patient with us! I've gone ahead and passed this along to the team working on this. They'll be able to take a look and hopefully get a better idea as to what's happening here.

Hey thanks Katy Khaos! Is this bug still being experienced by other Mac users as well? I noticed a slowdown in the number of Mac bug/complaint treads on the Report a Bug page for the past week or so... So I was wondering if it's just me still or if this is still an issue for other Mac users.

It appears it does still affect a small percentage of Mac users. Riot Decrepit (who is working more closely with the issue than myself) [made this post](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/bug-report/iuBXmiwW-riotdecrepit-please-can-you-fix-this-mac-audio-bug?comment=0000), the remaining players may have systems that do not meet our game's minimum requirements (listed in his post). 

If this is not the case with you, please let me know and I can pass on any additional information we can grab. If you could pass along your DxDiag to me, that'd be a solid start! :)

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=8gxEE5vQ,comment-id=0002000200000000000000010000,timestamp=2016-05-05T16:54:39.843+0000)
>
> It appears it does still affect a small percentage of Mac users. Riot Decrepit (who is working more closely with the issue than myself) [made this post](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/bug-report/iuBXmiwW-riotdecrepit-please-can-you-fix-this-mac-audio-bug?comment=0000), the remaining players may have systems that do not meet our game's minimum requirements (listed in his post). 
> 
> If this is not the case with you, please let me know and I can pass on any additional information we can grab. If you could pass along your DxDiag to me, that'd be a solid start! :)

Hello again KateyKhaos! Thank you for dealing with my constant posts and being so helpful, I really appreciate it. So I just checked Riot's minimum specs for Mac and I do believe I meet these requirements. 

The Minimum stated on your website is:
- 2 GHz processor (supporting SSE2 instruction set or higher)
- 2 GB RAM (4 GB is strongly recommended)
- 5 GB available hard disk space
- NVIDIA GeForce 8600M GT / ATI Radeon HD 2600 or better
- Screen resolutions up to 1920x1200
- Mac OS X 10.7.5 or higher

My Late 2013 15 inch Retina Macbook Pro specs are:
Processor: 2.3 Ghz Intel Core i7
Memory: 16 GB 1600 MHz DDR3
Available Hard Disk Space: 380.21 GB (With LoL installed)
Graphics Card: Intel Iris Pro 1536 GB with optional discrete Nvidia GeForce GT 750M 
Screen Resolution: 2880 x 1800
Operation System: Mac OS X 10.11.4

I'm currently at University, and my roommate has also been experiencing the same issue as I have with League of Legends since patch 6.6. Prior to 6.6, neither him nor I had any issues. He has a 13-inch Retina MacBook Pro with similar specs to mine.

I would love to send you my DxDiag, but uh... heh... I'm not  _that_ tech savvy, so I have no idea what those are, or how to send them to you. If you cold provide me with instructions though, I would be happy to provide my DxDiag's to you :) Again, thanks for all the help!

Of course - thanks for being patient! 

I'm going pass this on to Riot Decrepit, who can analyze this and may have a better idea what's going on. 

As for your DxDiag, you can grab it here - 

* Press [Command].
* Type dxdiag in the search bar and hit 'Ok'
* The DirectX Diagnostic Tool will open. Press the "Save All Information..." button.
* Choose where to save the file (for example, your desktop).
* Attach the DxDiag to your response on the forum. (You'll need to upload it to a website first - pastebin could work here -  and then post the link, since you can no longer just attach a file on the boards anymore).

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=8gxEE5vQ,comment-id=000200020000000000000001000000000000,timestamp=2016-05-05T18:24:21.031+0000)

> * The DirectX Diagnostic Tool will open. Press the "Save All Information..." button.

> * Attach the DxDiag to your response on the forum. (You'll need to upload it to a website first - pastebin could work here -  and then post the link, since you can no longer just attach a file on the boards anymore).

Ohhhhhhhh wait. DxDiag refers so DirectX Diagnostic tool. But Katey Khaos I am using a Mac running on OS X, so I do not have, and cannot run DirectX Diagnostic tool as it is a Windows only application. Is there a similar application I can us for Mac? If so, what should I do?

(Literally shows how much I know about Macs.)

You're going to want Apple Hardware Test. To perform a more thorough diagnostic test, select the "Perform extended testing" checkbox under the Test button before you click the Test button.

That should give all the info we need!

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=8gxEE5vQ,comment-id=00020002000000000000000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-05-05T20:18:28.895+0000)
>
> (Literally shows how much I know about Macs.)
> 
> You're going to want Apple Hardware Test. To perform a more thorough diagnostic test, select the "Perform extended testing" checkbox under the Test button before you click the Test button.
> 
> That should give all the info we need!

Okay so I referenced some Apple Support articles how to run an Apple Hardware Test, and apparently it is an option that Apple did away with in all Macs made after June 2013. Apple Hardware Test was replaced with Apple Diagnostics, which has no option for "extended testing" like in the older Apple Hardware Tests. In the newer Apple Diagnostics, I held down Command-D upon startup, which automatically started a test, i.e. there was no test button or checkbox for extended testing. Upon running the test, the result came up with...

"The battery requires service.

It is not functioning normally, though you may not notice a change in its behavior or the amount of charges it holds. You can continue to use your battery before it's checked, without harming your computer.

Reference Code: PPT004"

I did some research on this code, and many Macbook Pro users report coming up with this code, taking it to an Apple Store for service, and then being told the code is a the result of a false positive. In the "System Information" utility under Power>Health Information, the Cycle Count is 398, with the condition reading as "Normal." Furthermore, I don't know why the condition of my battery would affect connectivity or gameplay in League of Legends, especially considering that I play with my laptop plugged into AC Power at all times, but then again, I've been wrong before. Thanks for the replies, and I hope this helps!
Hmm. That's odd. Lemme pass this on to our compat bros and see if this is something they've encountered!

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=8gxEE5vQ,comment-id=00020002000000000000,timestamp=2016-05-02T16:27:56.799+0000)

I'm sorry for going completely off topic here but by any chance do you know when the Riot ward skin will be available for purchase?
The Riot Fistbump Ward skin is not available for purchase - it's earned by going to events where Riot may be present or meeting a Rioter IRL.

Awwww really?

That sucks. Thanks for the response.
Sorry! D:

I posted a thread about this in support and they said it was my internet connection. I went to a friend's house and tried playing on his network. No luck. Support continued to claim it was an internet issue but it seems to me that its not because a lot of players are having this issue and it can't be an internet problem with this many complaints. i tried it today (months later) and it still does not work. has any solution been found?

Just wanted to leave a comment to let you know how this patch has been so far on OSX Miss Katey.

Frame drops are still unreal bad on the live patch. I typically play floating anywhere from 50-70 FPS, With audio on, or disabled, I am getting anywhere from 14-20 and the frames are terribly stuttery/jittered/delayed. The audio itself does not have the bug as before where the sound would get scratchy / inaudible, however the FPS are just as bad if not worse as now even with the audio disabled the FPS drop is still there.
What's stopping you guys from reverting the audio files to 6.5 and working forward to fix the problem.

To be honest, I'm not sure. As I've mentioned, the fix did work on PBE, so there is a resolve for this. 

Again, just a messenger. D:
SHOOT HIM!
can't even play the game because of this, had to go over to a friends house...

Every. Single. Patch... 
There are people crying about mac issues. 

May I suggest a radical solution which may solve your problems; a real pc? Just think about it.

Every. Single. Patch. For what, 3 patches? Strange that out of 6 seasons and 3 patches this season, didnt realize thats "every single patch"

May we suggest you play on a real server? Just think about it.

For the record, I was having problems with patches 6.5-6.7. This latest patch (6.8) seems to have corrected everything I had previously been experiencing.

13-inch Mid-2010 Macbook Pro
Yosemite 10.10.5
2.4 Gig Intel Core-2-Duo
4 Gig DDR3

Can update: the audio and frame rate drops during teamfights has gone away somewhat. It's still there but not nearly as bad as before. I have put my graphical settings back up to medium for now to test everything and it's actually playable again (before I was forced to use very low or the frame rates would drop drastically out of nowhere), the frames on medium are around 40-60 which is roughly 20 frames less than I used to be able to have on high-medium so it's still not great but it's at least working. The major problem now is that there is lag/bug that happens periodically where the ping and framerate does not drop, the game just ceases to respond to player movement or buttons while everything else seems to be running normally. Please continue to work on these bug issues for Mac users, Riot. Thanks.

> We have been constantly asking for updates

And that's everyone's freakin problem!  Do you realize how many effing posts there are regarding this?  All of you just flood the boards instead of giving one post a crap ton of upvotes.  If it were me, I would ignore all of you and reply to just ONE thread.  I don't know how Katey does it, but she seems to have the patience to not be annoyed by how many whiny babies we have here.  Very few of you act like adults and it is depressing.  

In my opinion, all of you just want the "achievement" of having a Rioter comment on your post.  You don't get anything for it!  No RP/IP/LP...nothing!  

Seriously, none of you seem to read the Red Tracker.  Easiest place to find answers from Rioters is there!  They have responded to this issue days ago.  Learn to research.

What works better in a protest or rally. One gigantic sign. Or four thousand individual signs. 

Getting exposure is us flooding. You have nothing to contribute to this so kindly fuck off. 

Learn your role.
...protest? for what!? they even added a fix with this patch! if it does not work then show it and don' t whine like this!

And yet you still don't get that UPVOTING = FLOODING!  Just in a more respectful, non-baby-like manner.  The more popular the topic, the more viewing it will get by Riot.  Learn your role and grow the fuck up (if we're resulting to swearing now).

And you still don't understand that it took us 40 threads and 30 days to try and get a fix for a bug that's ceasing game play. You just felt the need to respond without offering any input just because you want to feel like you know how to do something differently. Well guess what? We don't care. If you aren't contributing move the fuck along. We have received responses throughout so your argument is invalid anyhow.
It will be fine they will make a fix when Urgot gets a rework aka never. God I hate this company so much.
I think Riot has shown that they care about Mac users just about as much as they care about Yorick.
Did the mage update come?
Just don't play on a Mac. Why would you do that to yourself anyways...
